meanings.definition: Not shy or reserved; forward or bold in manner
meanings.sent1: She was uncoy when she confidently raised her hand in class.
meanings.sent2: The uncoy child fearlessly approached the new student to say hello.
meanings.sent3: The uncoy puppy boldly stole a sock and paraded around the house with it.
meanings.sent4: His uncoy attitude towards challenges made him stand out among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The uncoy sun boldly painted the sky with vibrant colors at sunset.

meanings.definition: Not in accordance with accepted standards of behavior; improper or suspicious
meanings.sent1: His uncoy behavior at the party raised many eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: The uncoy remarks made by the guest made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The uncoy squirrel was caught stealing nuts from the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: The uncoy shadows lurking in the alley made her walk faster.
meanings.sent5: The uncoy smell coming from the kitchen hinted at a burnt dinner.
